titles.title: Structured Settlement Claimants Rights Act of 2019

To amend title 28, United States Code, to protect the right of a claimant in a civil action before a Federal court to retain a structured settlement broker to negotiate the terms of payment of an award, and for other purposes.
Structured Settlement Claimants Rights Act of 2019

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary:
Structured Settlement Claimants Rights Act of 2019
This bill allows a claimant in a civil action in federal court to retain a structured settlement broker to negotiate a schedule of payments for an amount previously agreed to be paid by the defendant in satisfaction of a judgment or settlement. The same right is afforded to parties in administrative agency adjudications.
